DARREN.raw_line: Come on... I'll take good care of you. All the bugs you can eat.You're gonna scare him away.Your problem, Steve, not mine... Steve gets a waggish idea. Stepping to the sink, pressing his forefinger over the spigot, he turns the faucet. WATER SHOOTS out in a stream, which Steve directs into and then over the stall door. Reacting, the spider zips up its thread, is lost in the darkened ceiling. The stall door opens. Dripping water, Darren stares at Steve who flashes a wicked grin...Go get the ball. It's 3 to 2. Lunch's almost over.A freak show. Ever been to one?Must be a different one. Steve scrolls down through pictures:I don't get it.Right. You're failing half your classes at school, but you're studying vampires.What? When?That's your proof? It smells. Steve's really trying to convince him now.Come on.What was his name? Mr. Dracula? Mad now, Steve opens the book, flips pages, finds an old 19th Century painting. He slaps down the science lab internet print-out of Larten Crepsley. It's the same guy! Maybe...Saw your shadow on the floor. Gotta try harder, knucklehead. Steve snaps his book shut, shoves it in his backpack.Get me one, too. Steve gets up, stomps out of the room.Huh? Tonight where? He zips the bag, slings it over his shoulder.I got no money right now.That place is supposed to be haunted. Steve rolls his eyes, starts out...What am I going to tell my parents?I don't know, man...Mom? I'm gonna sleep over Steve's tonight? Okay?What? Why not?I'm fourteen. I shouldn't even have to ask stuff like this.I've known him since I was five years old!But -- That's not fair!You know why they closed it, right? Years ago a kid fell out of the balcony and died. It's haunted.The balcony. Where he fell...He's as old as us.It's him...Reacts. A spider!Let's get outta here.Wait. What're you doing? Steve reaches the stage, looks around. The audience is mostly exited; no one from the Cirque is in sight. As Steve starts up onto the stage, Darren grabs his shoulder. Steve wheels, shoves Darren who stumbles back into a seat.Told by who? The guy in the chat room? The internet guy?Steve... Decision time. Darren climbs up, starts after his friend.Steve...? No answer. Darren decides, starts down steep, rickety steps.Coming down the creaky stairs. Spooky.Steve...Stops short as a LIGHT suddenly cuts through the gloom to his left. Darren steps over low behind a CREDENZA. He sees...Reacts as MADAM OCTA tries to jump on his face! The bars of her CAGE stop her. It rests on the credenza he crouches behind. The whistle is there too. Darren looks over as...Rooted to the spot. Watching...Moving slightly to get a clearer view.Can't believe what he's watching. He sees Crepsley suddenly get 'scent' of something. Something to do with Steve's blood. Not quite a clear view as Crepsley grabs Steve's wrist, dabs a finger into his palm and then tastes it.Frozen to his spot, watches as Crepsley, seemingly ill, holds his head and spits again onto the floor. Then he steps over and kicks the fridge door closed. And in the blink of an eye, he's gone. Disappeared. Darren is alone. He starts out, then stops. Looks back. That beautiful spider. And Darren takes Madam Octa's cage and the whistle and makes a run for it. Just like that.Oh. You want that? Darren picks up the worm, lowers it between the bars. A beat and then Madam Octa snatches it away from him. Dinner.See? I'm your friend... You're so beautiful I stopped thinking. The wind rustles. Darren grabs the cage, continues.It was down at the old Zeiterion Theater. Look, dad, I'm sorry. It's just, I couldn't resist. I --Yeah? So?Steve had money. Darren's Dad's suspicion is confirmed.He wouldn't do that.Man, what is this? You don't want me hanging around with him. Now you say you think he stole money? Do you know for sure?Steve's had some bad times lately. I'm trying to be a good friend.I have to sneak out! You treat me like a kid! A moment as Darren's raised voice rings out of the room.It wasn't like that. A beat. Darren's Dad goes, closing the door. Darren sighs. He goes to the window, pulls up the cage. He scans a look outside. Except for his Dad, the coast is clear.Annie, you gotta learn to knock.Out. Annie sighs, heads out. Darren puts the cage in the closet.Mom, this is the best omelette I ever had. His Dad can't help but smile. Good move. Mom is pleased, but knows she's being manipulated. As Annie stifles a laugh, Darren shoots her a look. A KNOCK at the kitchen door. Annie gets up, opens the door to reveal: Steve. From his angle he can only sees Annie.What happened last night?Don't worry. There's, you know, no bad blood or anything like that.I said don't worry.What are you, the word police? Steve gives him a look. A weird tension in the air. Darren glances at the bandage on Steve's palm, changes the topic.Wanna see that new game I got?Let me see that -- On the screen: the PHOTO OF MADAM OCTA. Steve twists around to keep the camera out of Darren's reach.I took it at the show.They were loading a van outside. I, I just took her.Just because he had a coffin doesn't mean he's really a... Darren trails off. Steve realizes Darren saw the coffin.I didn't believe it. Steve studies Darren, hopes that's true.I heard what you said to him, too. That you wanted to be a vampire. Steve doesn't want to talk about it. He looks at Madam Octa.I wish I knew how to play it.You mean telepathy?I swear to God, Annie...Steve... Annie reaches out, takes Steve's hand.Get dad. Go.I think some kind of a tarantula.It got away. Darren's Dad holds up the camera.Hello?Crosses don't hurt you?Because... you're evil.That's different. Bats are animals.Your spider bit my friend Steve. Crepsley shrugs, tosses Darren back his crucifix.He's dying.You have to help him!I'll pay you back. If it takes 50 years. Whatever it costs.There's something you want. That's why you're here waiting for me. Right? Crepsley's surprised and pleased by Darren's intuitiveness.He wanted to... become like you.I think so...I don't believe that someone can have bad blood.You're crazy. There's no way.Destiny? That doesn't make sense.Not for me.There's gotta be another way.Please... He's my friend.You'd never be able to trust me. If I got a chance for payback I'd take it.How'd we get here?What's happening?He's my friend.Never met him. I don't think Steve ever did either. Why do you want to know? And then Steve comes around. He opens his eyes, focuses on Darren for a moment. He looks puzzled.What?Don't ever do that again. Annie's smile drops away. As Darren continues on...Yeah?It's cruel.I killed it. Steve hesitates, processes, looks Darren over.Tell me about it later. Darren starts away. Steve grabs him hard, spins him around.I said later. Darren lets go, heads off. Steve watches, wonders.Got you something. Darren pulls the MOUSE from his pocket. Annie loves it, cups it in her hand.No it's not. King's my buddy.Come on. As Darren hurries Annie along down the street...The usual. Sometimes it was boring, sometimes really boring. Darren's mom laughs. Then...Standing at the blood's seeming siren call. But as he suddenly moves forward, she turns away. Darren stops as she wraps her finger in a paper towel. She looks back at him: misunderstands his hunger for concern.You're different...Hello? Hey! Crepsley appears. Darren turns, sees him. A beat. Crepsley raises his hands to the gloom around them.I'm starting to think it's me that's scary. Crepsley waits to hear more.It's only gonna get worse, isn't it? There's no way back, is there? No magic potion to make me human again? Crepsley shakes his head. Darren nods that he understands.We made a deal. I won't run away again.I can't just -- My family, I can't let them think I just left them. Or that something happened to me. My mother would... She couldn't... As Darren trails off, Crepsley really does look sympathetic.What?I'm going to bed. They say 'good night' to him. Impulsively, Darren kisses his dad on the cheek, then does the same to his mom.I love you both. I don't say it that much, but I do. Darren's Mom is caught off guard, but happy to hear it.Good night. They watch him go, then exchange looks.Goodbye, knucklehead. If I can ever help you, I will.Shut up. Off Crepsley's reaction...This is my home and I'm never gonna see it again, so don't rush me. Crepsley makes a motion to zip his lips. All the same, he stands, unscrews the bottle as Darren takes a last look around. He takes a PHOTO of his family off the dresser.Hold onto this for me, okay? Crepsley takes the photo, offers Darren the bottle in return. Darren sniffs, recoils at the foul smell.You're sure it will work? Crepsley opens the window.What if I break bones?And the funeral home? Won't they embalm me or something?My dad's allergic to grass. It's my job to cut the lawn.So this is destiny, huh? Tastes like crap. Darren body seizes up. He lets go, but Crepsley grabs him.My legs are asleep.What are you doing here?What do you have against vampires? You wanted to become one yourself.Are you crazy? I did it to save your life. That was the deal. Me for you.I want you to leave... Steve is just beginning to realize how strong Darren is now.I want you to leave and forget you ever saw me. Understand? Scared, he nods. Darren shoves him away, brakes the stake in two. Steve heads away, looks back over his shoulder.Would a stake through the heart kill a vampire?Before what's over?Let's go.How's that? Dark enough?It's sunrise.Maybe I'll wait until noon and then open every door and curtain in the place. A long tense silence as Darren awaits Crepsley's reply.Minnesota... Darren jots this state down on a LIST he's keeping. About twenty state license plates so far.I don't understand.But altogether you're 211 plus 20. You're really 231 years old.Where do you keep your car anyhow?The one you were driving around my town in. The old black one.It was near school one day. It followed me home a few days later.I couldn't see who was driving.What?Go. Run. But Crepsley appears beside her. He 'breathes' into his hand, 'guides' the air into her face. He catches her as she passes out. Darren is horrified.Did you kill her?Will she become a vampire?Don't take too much.What others? But as blood oozes, he takes the woman's wrist td his mouth. Darren is repulsed, but can't look away. Crepsley takes a few deep swallows, then holds the wrist out to Darren.No. I won't.I'll never do it. Crepsley runs his tongue over the cut, rubs the saliva in.I'm only half-vampire.I'll die first.What is it? As the woman starts to stir...Something out there scares you. What is it?The blood... I wanted it. I wanted to drink it.Thank you. Darren turns to face the window as he wipes his eyes, nose. Then he sees it: parked across and down the street... A black 1966 Lincoln Continental. Darren looks back at Crepsley.The car... Crepsley follows the finger as Darren points. DING DING! The bell over the diner door rings...Where'd you hear that?Who is?See what? The air seems to buzz as something 'passes'.It's behind us! Crepsley bears down, the buildings streaking by. But...Who were they? Vampires?How dangerous can a man named Mr. Tiny be?Then what is he?Yeah? Keep talking.But some didn't?What? That's crazy.Oh yeah... This is so much better than where I used to be... Crepsley hears the strain in his voice. Knows what's best for both of them..Half vampire.I liked it better where I was.Do you eat mice?I caught your act in the last town. Pretty cool.Snakes can catch cold? Evra nods, then SNEEZES himself.Who are they all?How did they end up here?Oh, I'm Darren.I snuck out to see it once, too. And I'm still here. An odd, almost spooky moment. Is he serious?You have no idea... Evra smiles, sticks out his tongue. Pointy, narrow, Evra sends it up his own nostril. Sam tries to smile, then starts up after Debbie. Freaked out. As Darren and Evra laugh...How long have you known Mr. Tall?How do you meet someone like him?Almost done. Crepsley looks to the sky. Still dark. The moon setting.I just felt sick for a second.You think Mr. Tiny might come? Crepsley shrugs, doesn't answer.Who is he? What does he want?Can't you give me a straight answer just once?!No. I never thought about it.I'm not a child. Theystop by the shadows.I'm in between.You guys are friends?Who was hunting you?He tried to kill us.What are you guys talking about!? No answer as Crepsley and Gavner lock each other in a look.I won't drink blood if that's what you mean. I promised myself.You'll get insulted. As Gavner waits for Darren to tell him...I'm afraid if I drink blood, I'll become evil. Gavner LAUGHS out loud, catches himself.That's how it would start. I would swear it was just to stay alive. But what'll I turn into? You're on one side of the fence or the other. My father used to say that and now I know what he meant. The 'father part' chokes Darren up a bit.Why did Crepsley make himself an exile anyhow?With the vampaneze?You've known him a long time?Why'd he choose you?Is it why he chose me? Gavner hesitates, not sure.The vampaneze? Mr. Tiny?Lucky for me. Glad I could help. All the same Darren considers what he's heard. Gavner, meanwhile, considers the open countryside ahead.That part is definitely cool.Nothing.Don't know. I'm congested.Must've been a long time ago.No. No parents. He says it with a little twinge that Debbie picks up on.You have to be different to be here.He's a snake-boy.I get scared easy. Darren looks up toward the rafters. From where she dropped.How'd you get up there anyhow?You're crazy!I got nothing to prove.Why's that?What's that?Is Sam your boyfriend?Oh... A funny, awkward beat out on the rafter. Finally...We should get off this. She nods, a bit smitten. Darren turns. As they start off...Chalk it up to lack of blood, but everything starts spinning.It's okay. I'm okay. Darren swings up a leg, hooks it over the rafter. A beat and he's back on top. Debbie relieved. Evra backs up the way he came and in a few seconds they're all safely off the rafter.You wouldn't have fallen in the first place... I just got dizzy.She's kind'of cool, huh? I mean, for a girl.She's just curious.What makes you such an expert?What's good about it? Crepsley looks him over, doesn't like what he sees.He stops as Sam and Debbie catch up with him.You guys are coming to the show again tonight?Oh, you came to see Evra.Hey, I'll catch up with you later. I got some stuff I gotta finish up.I'm fine.No! I won't let you hunt some poor person down for me. I -- Crepsley grabs hold of Darren, hauls him into...No. I can't. I'm human. Crepsley releases Truska's arm.I am human. In my heart I am. A great big TEAR rolls down Truska's cheek. That's the last thing Crepsley needed to see. He's defeated.This way. Darren brings him down to a handful of seats. The figure looks up from under the brim of his hat. It's Mr. Tiny.I don't think so. As Darren moves to go, Mr. Tiny clamps a hand around his wrist. Like iron. He sits, pulling Darren down beside him.He said you can't be explained. You need to be experienced.You've chosen the vampaneze. Mr. Tiny laughs, slaps his knee even.Terrible profits.What prophesy?I think you're a creep. I think you suck.Forget about her -- Murlough takes hold of Darren's other wrist. Still low:You guys are in trouble. There's more than one vampire now. Gavner Purl is here. Murlough reacts to the name. Does not like it.Crepsley! Look out! The audience LAUGHS. Like Darren's worried about Madam Octa. Debbie looks back, knows something is wrong. Sees Mr. Tiny's hand around Darren's wrist.Concentrating. Trying to flit.Speeding down to the stage. The dagger descends in slo- motion, but it's only a centimeter or two from it's target.He doesn't care about me.Steve? Steve! Steve holds up his hands so Darren can see the WHITE SCAR on the tip of each finger. He gets closer.Is that who you talked to? Was that the internet guy? Mr. Tiny?Has lost sight of them, he can only hear the battle now. He reacts as Evra, Debbie and Sam rush out. Evra takes hold, lifts, tries to lessen the load on the chain.Are you guys nuts? Get outta here!Evra. I think I'm dying. He looks horrible.Oh Sam. Oh no... Darren crawls over, takes Sam's bloody hand.Forgive me, Sam, but I need strength. I need blood. As Darren extends his nails over Sam's wrist...We're going to save her together.Let her go.Shut up, Steve.It's over, Steve.Liar.Did you steal money from my mom's purse?Did you? Darren hanging there, dead grim. Steve's curious.No. It's just practically the last thing that ever happened between me and my dad was I was arguing with him.I was telling him he was wrong about you. That's the last time we had together. Fighting about you.I miss him.Do you understand?I miss him so much. WHAM! Steve's arm pinwheel for balance. He's going over. But just as he pitches off the end rafter... Darren catches him by his belt. Nearly bent backward, he hangs back over the abyss. If Darren lets go, Steve will fall into the spikes below. Crespley steps up beside Debbie, knows what Darren should do.Start running. Don't ever stop. Steve hesitates. It wasn't supposed to be like this. Darren starts off the rafter toward him. One last look of hate.Are you gonna be okay?You think I made a mistake, don't you?Half human. What now?There's a war on, isn't there? Crepsley shrugs.This world is crossed by fences. You have to decide which side you stand on.It's not gray. I've met the bad guys. They need to be stopped.But you said it. There's no in between. And the power of being alone is never going to be greater than the weakness. It's our fight.He didn't die in vain. A beat.You never know. As she hugs him tight, she whispers in his ear:Where are we going?So what are we waiting for? Let's go. Crepsley offers his hand.

STEVE.raw_line: Hey, Darren! No answer. Steve walks along the stall, scoots low so he can see any feet in front of the bowls.Did you fall in? Darren!Man, we're getting killed out there. It's three to nothing. Darren is all concentration as the spider drops a little.GOAL! Three to one! The other team regroups, starts back upfield with the ball. Darren steals it. A few strides and WHUMP! Darren catches the goalie too far out. The ball lofts just over the backpedaling goalie's head, bounces into the goal.What does that prove? Huh? The goalie blanches as Steve moves at him. Kids are nervous about Steve. He likes to fight. Darren gets between them.That's why he kicked it. To kill time. Well, I still got time to kick your face.You idiot! The car SCREECHES to a stop, idles ominously. Suddenly Steve doesn't seem so tough. He looks nervously back to Darren. But as a WIND picks up, the Lincoln suddenly tears off. A sheet of PAPER is kicked up by one of the car tires. The wind sends it sailing. It drifts down, until... Steve notices, snatches it out of the air. Darren steps up beside him, watches the Lincoln disappear down the street. Creepy...Look at this. The paper is a FLYER. A startling, violent layout. Beneath a snarling WOLF'S HEA.Human oddities and other living curiosities...I gotta show you something...Vampires. I've been studying them. Vampires? Darren looks at him a beat.They been around 1000's of years. Two tribes. They even fight wars.Okay, sometimes, when humans fight? They fight at the same time. And no one knows it. Like at the Battle of Stalingrad they fought at the same time the Russians and Germans were fighting. Darren just looks at him, wonders if he's serious.Some people know about it. There have even been books written. He pulls a frayed old yellow hardcover from his bag.It's everywhere if you look. On the internet, in blogs, newspapers, weird places. But you can find it. The room starts to tighten a notch around them.I chatted online with one of them.Serious. We become aware of...Here he is in 1923. And here 1855. Huh? Maybe he'll be there tonight. Would that make you believe? As Darren looks them over, the POV looms up behind them. Suddenly Darren spins... And ROARS at what's behind them: his sister Annie. She SCREAMS in response. Steve jumps a mile. Darren LAUGHS.I'm gonna get a soda.Sorry, Mrs. Shan.I wish I was.She's okay... She's been working a lot lately. A little frown of concern crosses Darren's mom. Something about Steve... His mom... He brings out a bottle of soda.I know. Darren's mom exits as Steve pulls down two glasses, starts to pour soda. As he waits for the foam to settle, he sees... The purse. Just there. A quick look around, it doesn't take him long to decide. Steve steps over, opens the purse. A quick rifling finds a wallet: $200 in $20's. He peels off three bills, shoves them in his pocket. BLLEEEP! A cell phone starts going off in the purse. Fumbling, frantic, Steve stuffs the rest of the money back in the wallet, the wallet back in the purse, closes the purse -- Darren's Mom is back in. She's hurrying to get to her celiphone, so...I gotta go. See ya tonight.Cirque du Freak.Don't sweat it. I got money. Meet me ten to Midnight. The Zeiterion Theater.Tell them you're sleeping over. We can meet early, walk over together.D, it's Cirque du Freak. You wanna hear about it Monday? Or see it tonight? Steve lets his point sink in, then goes.I came here after your house. There was a van there, guy selling tickets. Rest is history. They cross toward the ornate, albeit crumbling facade of the ZEITERION THEATER. Deserted, except for a few CANDLES burning on the sidewalk by a door. The wind moans.Get inside.We're here to see the show. He takes an ominous step forward, then holds out a hand.Maybe he heard me say it.No, you go. I'm staying. Steve starts down toward the stage. Darren follows.This is my destiny. Don't ruin it. Steve looks dangerous as he looms. Darren raises his hands in surrender. Steve eases off, but he's still intense.That car today. It was a sign. Sending me here. I was told there'd be a sign. CREPSLEY.raw_line: It's not true. That all tarantulas are poisonous. Though some can kill a man. With one bite. Crepsley whisks off the covering. In the cage: a TARANTULA the size of a large man's hand. So big you can make out individual eyes. As deadly looking as it is beautiful.Her name? Madam Octa. Pray that she never learns yours. Two of the blue-robed 'little people' lead a GOAT onto the stage. A ripple of worry runs through the crowd. Crepsley starts over. The goat BLEATS. The little people hold it. Mr. Crepsley flicks open the cage door with his finger. The spider sets its front legs on the bars, pulls itself through. A few gasps from the audience. The goat bucks. Madam Octa bares her fangs, poised to leap on her prey. Several audience members CRY OUT that this should stop. Crepsley looks out with mock-theatrical surprise.No...? Shall it be life? Chuckling to himself, he looks to the goat tenders. They release the goat which bee-lines its way off the stage. Crepsley faces the audience.I wonder if you would be as shocked to see the same fate for me? Madam Octa moves -- climbing the outside of the cage -- taking a cautious step onto the hand holding the cage, then starting up Crepsley's arm. He stands dead still.Though we have been together such a long time, she is no pet. I think she would quite enjoy killing me. Crepsley calmly raises his free hand. It holds a shiny TIN WHISTLE. Madam Octa has reaches his shoulder.For her bite there is no cure. Madam Octa bares her fangs, even longer now. Her malevolence about to be directed at her master. Crepsley carefully puts the whistle to his mouth and starts to play, as simple as it is evocative. Madam Octa hesitates. Then, she moves around his throat, starts to climb his face using his scar as her guide. She gets to the top of his head, stands in his shock of hair. She sways; she's dancing! Then she leaps, lands on the end of the whistle. Crepsley keeps playing as Madam Octa attaches a web, drops down about 18 inches off the end. She starts to swing. Crepsley takes the whistle from his mouth and twirls it around. Octa does a few 360s and the thread breaks. She sails up high over Crepsley's head. He cranes back to watch as down she comes, legs splayed. She lands flat on his face. The whistle is in his hand. Crepsley looks out at the audience. Looking out between her hairy legs, his eyes are wide with horror. Without warning, the spotlight on him goes out. As the stage is plunged into darkness, we hear Crepsley SCREAM. A horrible, horrible sound. The audience wait, but nothing happens. Some of them rise from their seats, peer into the gloom. It's too dark. The sound of something being DRAGGED. Then nothing. A light comes up stage left as Mr. Tall steps out.Tell me, boy. Who am I?Too broad a definition. Do you introduce yourself as a human? Who I am is Larten Crepsley.Who sent you and what do they want?Then what do you want?Join me? I don't understand.Is it because you want to live forever? Because we don't.A long time alone. Do you want to live alone?Are you an orphan?Nor mine. You're friendless also?The power of being alone will never be greater than the weakness of it.It makes no matter. We do not blood children. I'm sorry. Steve pulls a JACKKNIFE from his pocket, flips open the 2- inch blade. Crepsley laughs out loud.Do you intend to use that on me? And we feel it more than see it, but Steve cuts into his own palm. He holds it up, moist and red in Crepsley's face.Do not tempt me.Crepsley shoves Steve down to the ground and immediately begins spitting onto the floor. Like it was poison.You have bad blood.I can taste the menace in your blood. You can never be a vampire. You're evil. Steve scrambles to his feet.Go home. Suddenly cowed, Steve just stands there blinking.What have you come for this time? Darren pulls out a CRUCIFIX, holds it in Crepsley's face. The vampire takes it, looks it over. It has no effect.Why should they?Am I? Are vampire bats evil when they drink the blood of cows?So am I. So are you. Our appetites don't make us evil. Why are you here?Yes, well, boys who play with things they do not understand can hardly complain if --The antidote to her poison is rare. Expensive. Why should someone as evil as I am waste it on Steve?Money doesn't interest me.The night Steve came below to speak to me, you were there. Did you hear what we talked about?You don't just 'become' a vampire. The change is too extreme. And if the shock didn't kill you, your inexperience would. So you become one in stages. A half-vampire at first. With greater strength than a human, but still able to go out in sunlight. You learn from a full vampire. Do you understand?But your friend has bad blood. He's no good. There's no telling what he'll become as he matures.And yesterday you didn't believe in vampires. Regardless, I've left the Cirque. Left my protection. I need someone to protect me while I sleep. A moment later and they're in the...Lick your fingers. Vampire spit will stop wounds from bleeding. Darren looks at his fingers, then around the lot.It's called flitting. Crepsley looks to Darren.Do you still question his blood? Darrenthoughtful, doesn't know what to think.Yes. But so would getting hit by a truck if it was going fast enough. Steve finally disappears from sight. Crepsley sighs.He'll be trouble before it's over.This adventure we're on. Shall we start? Darren nods again, still with him.I age 1 year for every 10, so, 211 divided by 10, I've aged about 21 years in that time. That 21 plus my first human 20 makes me look about 40.Exactly. A WOMAN exiting a BOOKSTORE.Dinner.I put her to sleep. She'll be like this 15 minutes. EVRA.raw_line: What do you do? Me? I'm a snake boy. I do a whole snake thing. Evra goes into a slithery snake walk for a few steps to illustrate. It's strange. Funny. Evra looks back over.Big Macs actually. They share a LAUGH. Evra 'high fives' Darren. Fast friends.Thanks. I'm not doing it tonight. My snake caught a cold.Still gotta work the floor though. Ushers. We get the seats filled. They pass PEOPLE all hurriedly crossing the camp.The backbone of Cirque du Freak. They do the driving, the tent pitching, the potato peeling even.Most wandered in. If Mr. Tall likes them, they stay. Darren's eye is caught by the WOLFMAN. He's being pushed toward the factory building by several of the blue-robed LITTLE PEOPLE. The wolfman's yellow eyes are on Darren as he rumbles a low, guttural growl. Darren is so taken that he almost walks into... Madam Truska. He stops short. In costume, beardless, even more beautiful than when we first saw her. She considers Darren, uses a finger to raise his chin. She shakes her head, smiles. As she continues...Can we help you find a seat?Only the best seats in the house. He leads them a few steps over toward a column.Oui. Vous etes observateur. Nous sommes les serpents frangais. That slows Sam a beat. Evra points out a small platform eight feet up the column. You have to climb a natural re-bar ladder to get there. Sam looks dubious, but Debbie smiles.Evra Von. She looks at Darren, waiting.Five years.I was raised in a circus, but not a nice one like this. The owner used to beat me and keep me in a glass cage. I felt like a useless freak. One night I looked out of my cage and saw Mr. Tall just standing there. He watched me until the owner came over and asked if he could help him. Mr. Tall grabbed him by the throat and strangled him to death. Then he opened the cage and said, "Let's go, Evra." He named me that. I added the Von. I've been with him ever since. Darren looks back at Mr. Tall with a new set of eyes.Let's scare the crap out of him... They begin to creep in, flanking the unsuspecting Sam. But as they get close, a SHAPE drops down behind them!What're you doing here?Off the hook, huh? I'll tell all the freaks you said so.No school either.Everyone has a place they belong. The Cirque du Freak is ours.It's okay. I am a snake boy.Hey, be careful.Come on, guys... Darren hesitates. Not because he won't do it, but because maybe for the first time in his life, he's really fascinated by a girl. Debbie misreads, starts CLUCKING again. Darren smiles, repeats her move effortlessly. Without warning, Debbie leaps the gap, lands on the rafter alongside Darren. As she struggles a bit for balance, Darren reaches out and steadies her. As they come face to face.Thanks for the heads up... Bro.Well, the food's down on ground level. Let's get out of here. Sam and Debbie start off, Darren and Evra following. As Sam and Debbie start down a ladder, Darren hangs back a beat.I like her. She asks a lot of questions though.There's no such thing as 'just' with a girl.My snake's a girl.Reacting as Debbie and Sam arrive. They move toward it.You guys better go back.Darren's my friend.Sam, unhook his legs. As Sam struggles, Debbie pulls the rag from Darren's mouth.It's against our code. Suddenly unhooked, Darren hits the ground. He looks up at Evra who grins down at him.Never leave a freak behind.Come on!It's okay. It's the wolfman. He's in his cage. They move forward again, the cage becomes visible. But another SHAPE beside it. Steve. He sets his hand on the cage's heavy latch. He's going to open it.No don't!He was brave.

DEBBIE.raw_line: Are there any left?You guys are with the Cirque? Darren nods. Sam's a little sarcastic and skeptical.Cool... I'm Debbie, this is Sam.Is the show great? Say yes. We had to sneak out to see it.You should see the look on your faces. But Evra and Darren are not laughing.We could ask you the same thing. We come here all the time. My grandfather used to work here.He says now it's like one of those bombed out World War II cathedrals. Empty of what is used to be. An odd little moment till Sam breaks it.Different how? Evra steps into a slash of sunlight and his skin flashes to life, the green of his scales catching the rays. Debbie's mouth drops. They couldn't see it in the dark last night.I think your skin is beautiful. That wins Evra over.Can I touch it? Evra holds out his arm. Debbie traces a finger across it.Wow. Has it always been this way?You shouldn't call him names because he looks different.What about you, Darren? How are you different?You mean, how did a girl get up there?How about you?But it'd be easier for you than me.Because chickens have wings. She starts chicken CLUCKING. Mad, Darren steps onto a rafter, starts across. He stops in the middle, spins around. Aided immeasurably by his half-vampire skills.Let's play mirrors.I do something and you have to copy me. Like this. Debbie crosses her arms the same way Darren has. He uncrosses them as he realizes. Debbie reaches down, touches her toes. Darren sighs, then does the same, gets a good look at the floor below. Debbie takes one foot off the rafter, takes hold of the top of it with one hand, raising the other arm out for balance. Looks like a ballerina. Evra doesn't like this daredevil stuff.There definitely something different about you. I just can't figure it out.He's my cousin.Hold on. Debbie grabs his arm. Evra starts out to help, but the rafter CREAKS OMINOUSLY. He stops. Sam states the obvious.I don't know how you hung on. I couldn't have.Maybe you need to eat something. Darren looks at her. She has no idea.Of course. Evra's doing his snake act tonight.And you... Darren smiles shyly at that.I know that. So?You're such an idiot, Sam.Hey, Darren. Darren looks up to see Debbie and Sam. Oh no...We're gonna sit on this side.He was great! As she looks back to the stage someone sits on Darren's other side. Collar pulled up, head wrapped in a scarf. Murlough!Ours too. Sam's not so sure, but he nods in agreement.Let's carry him if we have to. Evra and Sam support him on either side. They continue, start across part of a darkened backstage area. A dark rectangular shape looms ahead. We hear a GUTTURAL GROWL, sees eyes glow in the gloom. They freeze.Reacts in horror.Sam? Darren shakes his head. Sam didn't make it.Say what happened. Some crazy guy showed up. Sam was in the wrong place at the wrong time. They're all quiet a moment.Do you think we'll meet again?I hope so...
